import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Link issue to app"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/issues/{issueId}/link/app/{appId}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Links an issue to an external app so the app can surface or manage the issue in its own workflows. Use this when integrating issue catalogs with third-party applications.

**Prerequisites**
1. **issueId** - Use [GET /api/v1.0/issues](/docs/api/issues/list-issues) or [POST /api/v1.0/issues](/docs/api/issues/search-issues) and extract `Items[].IssueId`.
2. **appId** - Use the app's registration identifier from your integration settings.

**Workflow Example**
1. Identify the issue to link.
2. Link the app: [POST /api/v1.0/issues/\{issueId\}/link/app/\{appId\}](/docs/api/issues/link-issue-to-app).
3. Verify app-specific behavior in the integration UI.

**Minimal Required Fields**: issueId and appId (path).

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"issueId","in":"path","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}},{"name":"appId","in":"path","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>

  label={undefined}
